page.title: 05St Esprit Church Marton.
page.content: There has been a church in Marton for centuries. The first stone building was erected in 1296.It was demolished, due to its poor state of repair and rebuilt in 1871.Little remains of the original church.Its importance in the religious life of Marton has declined steadily.The vicar,who is based at Long Itchington,serves two parishes. There are 6 services a month and even_ song every two months for a regular congregation of 12.There is an active Altar Guild providing servers.However the villagers are enthusiastic about the upkeep of the church.Sixty ladies clean the church on a rota basis.On "Boon Day"all the ladies spring clean the church.They enter the "Best Kept Church yard" competition,in which they have been quite successful. The Flower Guild decorate the church for the great feast days .
